bib_record.title: A Measurement of the 25 Cross-Section for 0.53 MeV Neutrons by the Manganese Solution Method

free_txt: The concentric electrode electrostatic

The concentric electrode electrostatic
generator.
The protons were accelerated to the
accurately measured and controlled energy of 2.27 MeV
(using 1.86 MeV as the threshold).
The number of neutrons from the Li(p,n)
reaction for 2.27 MeV protons incident upon a lithium
target approximately 40 keV thick was compared with
the number of neutrons emitted by a 200 mc Ra-Be
source by the manganese solution method. The solution
tank used was 2 feet in diameter and 2 feet deep. The
strength of the Ra-Be source was taken as 1.9x10**6
neutrons per second but this value is subject to
change after recalibration by the Chicago group.
Determination of the Fission Rate: the two separated
foils, Mg-XIII-7 and Mg-C-3, were placed back to back
l/32 inch apart in a fission chamber which allowed
the simultaneous counting of the fissions due to each
foils This chamber has been improved by mounting the
first amplifier stages right below the chambers. The
scalar bias was set so as to count all pulses more
than twice the height of the alpha pulses. The
chamber was mounted directly in front of the target
at a distance of 1.864 inches from the center of the
foils to the center of the target. The above
comparison combined with a measurement of the angular
asymmetry of the neutrons from lithium and an
observation of the fissions induced in the Mg-C-3 and
Mg-XIII-7 gives the cross-section for 235U.
